reviewText: This is a more-detailed documentary than Scottish Covenanters, with more exploration of the theology of the Covenanters. This DVD was produced by the Reformed Presbyterian Church of Ireland, so it was probably subject to stricter budgetary limits than might a public TV documentary be. The audio is very tinny, as if it were all recorded in a toolshed. And the editing is a bit dodgy, such as one reference to the Covenanters in the Sixteenth Century, rather than the Seventeenth. But that is only a distraction, for the content is meaty, with much exporation of Erastianism versus a Reformed understanding of church government and its relationship to civil government. The DVD also includes a separate promotional video for the Reformed Presbyterian Church of Ireland, including some discussion of Psalmody.
